PIONEER RECREATION AND SOCIAL LIFE

RECREATION VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years, how many houses were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? How many of these were bachelor's houses?

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors?

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days?

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? What time of the day did you go? - In the morning, midday, or in the afternoon, etc.? What about meals? Did you stay when not invited beforehand? How was the invitation worded? Was it "would you come?" or "would you come?" (that is, was the term to "make polite" used, or was some other expression common?) If no meal, what other refreshments might be offered to visitors who had dropped in?

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to look after the place?

6. Did you ever have "open house" when groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? Tell what you remember about such gatherings, giving dates if possible, telling what the "house" were for, and how often they occurred.

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there any parties, whilst drives or dances in homes? Describe.

Were those more frequent in later years? Give dates.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one home to another at definite times, - every two weeks, once a week, once a month, etc.?
